alert.note: Alert for Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 2:06PM CDT until April 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, George, Greene, Perry and Stone. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 204 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of thunderstorms producing torrential rainfall over the advisory area. Rainfall amounts in excess of 1 to 2 inches will fall in a short period of time with these storms. Storm spotters reported flooding along Highway 49 south of the Wiggins city limits. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wiggins, Lucedale, Leakesville, Perkinston, McHenry, Avent, Leaf, Merrill, Benndale, Crossroads, Bexley, Dale, Deep Creek, Barbara, Neely, Oak Grove, Hillman, Evanston, Ramsey Springs and Bradley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
